storyInfo: Shamare arrives at a small town in Siracusa with a Rhodes Island Field Operation Squad. In the course of her mission, she quietly teaches the wicked local 'judge' a lesson, in her own way.

attributes.content: Shamare, the others are going to diagnose and treat the Infected patients in the ward. Will you be okay here by yourself?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Err, I mean... Morte will keep you company, so the two of you will be fine, right?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: ...Mm. You go and take care of them. I can handle things here.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: 'Handle'? I wasn't giving you an assignment...
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: (Well, whatever. Shamare is pretty mature compared to some of the other children at Rhodes Island, so I'll just trust her.)
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Alright, I'll get started with work then.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Morte, you heard that sound too, didn't you?
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: Mhm. I know, you'd recognize the sound of crying anywhere.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: Let's go.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: Signor Mauro, please don't do this. It'll only make things harder for me.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: As an Infected, if your insurance payment falls below half of the designated amount, you can no longer continue to work.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: B-But I already made a full payment... Yesterday, last night, your subordinates came by to collect it!
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: My subordinates? I didn't arrange for that, nor have I seen any of this supposed payment.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Look, it's written clearly in the code here that insurance money is to be collected by the judge.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: It's your responsibility to make sure the money gets to me. Otherwise, how would I know to update the records?
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: And I'm sorry, but according to the records, you're currently delinquent in your payments.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: But they... Last time they came around, they said, 'there's no way a judge would go around personally collecting debts'...
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Take another good look at this codex, and think back carefully. Are you sure you're remembering right?
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Oh, uhh... I'm so sorry, I seem to have misremembered. Pardon my foolishness, Your Honor.
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: But that doesn't change the fact that I don't have a single centesimo to pay...
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Is that so? What a pity. You're in no shape to accept the work we offer either.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Therefore, according to the law, my only option is to confiscate a piece of your property as collateral.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: I-I don't even have anything left worth that much...
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Oh? Are you implying that you're a better appraiser of value than I am?
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: But my family can't survive without food! P-Please, I beg of you... Just give me a little more time!
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: I swear, I'll find some way to get the money.
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: I only ask you to respect the rule of law. Understood?
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: ...Yes, of course.
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: And by sheer coincidence, there happens to be something of value right in front of me, which the law allows you to offer up as collateral.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: D-Do you mean this pocket watch here?
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: ...Oh, you're absolutely right! I can't believe I forgot!
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: As long as you remember now.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Now then, let's agree to meet again when the hour hand of this watch makes two full circuits.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Oh, thank you for your magnanimity...
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Then, according to the law, can get it back after I pay? Th-That's a keepsake from my great-grandfather's time in the famiglia's civil war... and it allows me some semblance of respect.
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Morte, should we go talk to that lady? ...Hm, it's better if we stay quiet?
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: There are already a bunch of curses following her. Something bad's gonna happen unless we do something.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: Hmm? What an unkempt child, running about all by herself...
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Are you looking for your family?
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Perhaps you should search a trash can in a back alley, the bottom of the river, the cemetery, or the garden... I'm sure they'd be somewhere like that.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Does it hurt, Morte? ...It's raining, but it's not hurting from the rain.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: She'll also be in unbearable pain.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: (What the hell did that girl just say?)
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: ...Damnit, this rain's giving me a headache. Let's not worry about it.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: The Messenger just arrived, and these are all for you.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: Did a postcard from Volsinii come in?
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: I wouldn't dare read your mail without permission.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: But you've done so much good work, I'm sure you'll receive the praise of the head... Dare I say, the postcard should already be on its way.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: Mm. Let's look through the other ones first.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: A gift from the boss of the paper mill, and compensation from twenty households on East Street. Not bad.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: An invitation from the town council? Why would I need this?
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: And a plea from their son in prison... Rubbish.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: ...Wait, hold on.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: There's something written on the back?
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Come here. I have a job for you.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Got it.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: ...You're letting that criminal out? But his famiglia hasn't coughed up the dough yet.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: Take a look at the back side.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: It's just a blank piece of paper...
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: *cough* Oh, of course. It's gotta mean the sender is going to be disposed of cleanly, without leaving any traces.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: While the very idea of using curses to vent your grievances is laughable, I don't want to see anyone trampling over my code of law.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Curses? What?
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: Alright, onto the next letter.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: —What's going on here?!
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: You, come back. Hand me that letter.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: If you say so.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: ...The exact same contents and handwriting.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Every letter! It's on every single letter!
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: 'Your malice has brought about a curse, and calamity shall follow in your wake. The black fowlbeast circles, and you will lose the only glittering thing on you.'
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: ...How juvenile.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Find out whose childish prank this is.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: But, it's just a blank sheet of paper.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: I mean... On it, boss! We'll find this prankster.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: Still no leads on those 'cursed' letters from yesterday? How many people could there possibly be in this tiny little town?
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Tch, maybe I need to find myself some more capable subordinates?
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: ...The pocket watch I took from that Infected is running five minutes slow.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: I must say, I am tolerant to a fault.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: I can only hope he doesn't betray that compassion.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Sir, do you remember when you first developed symptoms of Oripathy?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: I... I'm not sure. Maybe a few days ago?
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: To the best of your knowledge, do you have any clue how you might have contracted it?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: To be frank, based on our preliminary screening, you, like many others here, recently came down with an acute infection.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: We need to locate the source of the epidemic to try to contain the spread of Oripathy in town.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Umm, I'm not quite following.
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: I-I used to work in the back kitchen of that restaurant over there, that's all I know. Seriously, I don't know a thing.
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Alright. Sorry for bothering you then.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Shamare, did you notice anything unusual over there? Like, have you felt the effects of active Originium, or lost control of your Arts like before?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Shamare? What are you looking at?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: ...Black fowlbeast.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: Who are you people? What are you here for?
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Oh, hello there. We're a medical organization, and we're working with the town hospital to provide some technical support.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: So, you're from Columbia?
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Not quite...
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: In any case, I need to talk to this gentleman here. Now, if you'll excuse me—
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: —Gah! A fowlbeast?!
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Shoo! Go away! Stop pecking me!
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Oh, she dropped her pocket watch...
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: ...What are you tugging on my sleeve for?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Wait here. Don't move.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: *cough*, *cough, cough*... Tch, the damn thing finally flew off.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: But a black fowlbeast...
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Hah, how could someone put a curse on me?
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Your Honor, I... Um, is there anything I can do for? Do you need me to tidy up your clothes?
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: No, I simply want to see the law upheld.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Oh, of course, you're here for the insurance money... Here you go.
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: This isn't enough.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: But... You haven't even counted it yet.
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: The envelope should be at least three times as thick. Did you not remember to include the late fees?
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Look, it's written right here in the codex. That's the law. My hands are tied.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: ...I see, I must have remembered wrong. I'll try looking for somewhere else to borrow money, so please, give me a little more time.
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Of course. I am nothing if not tolerant.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: (Where'd that beat-up gold pocket watch go? Did I drop it somewhere?)
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: (The curse... No, this was just a coincidence. How could anyone believe in curses?)
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: ...In any case, I'll see you again in two days.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Damn my luck! Fine, if that's what it takes, then so be it!
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: You accursed eyeless fowlbeast! It's all your fault! If she weren't in such a bad mood just now, this whole thing would already be settled!
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Morte, could you pick up the pocket watch?
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: Mm. It didn't break when it fell.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: Here, this is yours.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: (I knew it, Shamare used her Originium Arts. We could all see it fall to the ground, but somehow the judge didn't notice.)
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: (Has she already matured to the point where she's this considerate of others?)
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: (Does she even realize how incredibly brave that was just now?)
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: (...But even with all the Arts training she's had at Rhodes Island, casting something like that must be stressful on her body.)
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: (Anyway, she might be doing the right thing, but I'll need to keep a closer eye on her condition... and help her out if necessary.)
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: ...Huh?
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: It represents 'famiglia' to you. 'A very big family.' It's important, right?
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: Do you not want it back?
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: ...What are you talking about? Th-That isn't mine.
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: I've never seen it in my life. Do whatever you want with it, since I've certainly never seen it before! And I definitely didn't see it today!
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: ...Really?
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: You're pretty energetic today, Morte.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: What'd you eat? Sadness? Fear? Or resentment?
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: Why are you afraid? I wanna know too.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: J-Just turn around and leave with that pocket watch! I'm shutting the door!
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: But I still wanna know.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: Obviously there's not a single word written in that lady's book.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: So why didn't you tell her?
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: ...Anyone can see it's a legal codex; how could there be no words written in it? I bet you don't know how to read anyway.
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Hey, you, the doctor over there! Aren't you an adult? Take this crazy kid away from me! Get away from me and my house!
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Let's go, Shamare.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Everything's been smooth sailing today. No cases in need of a hearing.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: Only minor stuff on the streets too. Someone ran into a mugger while eating at a restaurant, but they turned out to be one of the recently Infected who hasn't paid their dues.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: Which ensures we're getting our money on time.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Yup. Also...
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: It seems a lot of folks have been talking about you behind your back.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: Talking? About what?
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Some crazy 'prophecies' scribbled on posters in the alleys.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: I sent some people to find who did it, but no luck. All the posters should be taken down by now though.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: What, are there still people out there who haven't learned to respect the will of the law?
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: So, who are these people who've been gossiping about this instead of reporting it to me?
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: About that... I haven't heard of anyone actually talking about it.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: You're contradicting yourself. If nobody's talking about it, then how are they talking about it?
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: ...Same way as always.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: They keep quiet, but you can see it in their eyes.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: One look at their shifty gazes, and you know the score.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: What are you thinking? Shamare and I were just enjoying a meal when you walked over. You were patting your two children on the head just now...
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Frankly, I thought you were coming in to order two kids' meals for them.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Turns out, you're trying to rob us?!
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: This is just how we do things, outsider!
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Stop struggling. Shamare and I won't let you cause any trouble. This is how we do things.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Hah... Weren't you guys there yesterday? Didn't you see how much insurance money I owed?
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: If you actually care whether we Infected live or die, then put your money where your mouth is and don't stop me!
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: I might not fully understand your circumstances, but I do know that what comes around goes around.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Look, your two kids are still playing with the other kids out on the street. If you make a customer here bleed, what do you think is going to happen to them next?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: ...Then tell me, what should I do?
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: If they end up kicking me and my family out of the house, what else is there for me to think about?
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: ...That won't happen.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: Morte will help.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: Mortw will help me find more.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: The soil here is already full of resentment and fear. I just need a few other things.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: ...What?
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Uh, don't worry about it. I'll help her help you.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Help me? What can you people possibly do?
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Sometimes, when a person is tormented by malice so thick that it completely engulfs them, their mind can jump to the craziest things—even hallucinations. Isn't that right?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Just don't cause any trouble for me like last time.
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: ...Oh right, Signor Mauro, we'd like to schedule an appointment with you.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: If that woman claiming to be a judge doesn't come by tomorrow to collect your debt, we'd like to ask you a bit more about the large number of Infected here. Can you do that?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: 'Your malice has brought a curse upon you'... The same as last time.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Hah, utter nonsense.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: For sure. How could anyone take a prank like this seriously?
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: We're still looking for whoever's behind this garbage, but... Well, the hard part is, none of us have ever seen this 'cursed text' ourselves.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: We've managed to piece together the contents, but nobody seems to know who left it behind... Or at least, nobody's telling us anything.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: She realizes that the pedestrians along the street are avoiding her gaze, but nevertheless seem curious and inquisitive as they walk past her.
Silence is a form of order, but at the moment, she finds their silence terrifying.
...Tch.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: I don't feel like wasting any time on that Infected today. If he doesn't come up with the money, just confiscate his house.
attributes.name: Town Judge
Town Judge
attributes.content: This is the last time I'll—

attributes.name: Town Judge
attributes.content: Urgh!
attributes.joined: This is the last time I'll—Urgh!

attributes.text: 'Your malice has brought a curse upon you. The soil here is unwilling to bear your weight any longer, and the evil spirits that linger shall make you fall so hard that you will be unable to walk again.'

attributes.content: The moment she falls to the ground, the curse she'd heard echoes through the judge's mind.
A sharp pain shoots through her calf, and she hears whispers from the side of the road.
A-Are you alright? I'll help you up. There are too many people staring; it'll ruin your image...
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: Get away from me!
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: If you say so.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: Damn it all... Are you blind?! I'm hurt! Take me to the hospital!
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Uhh, okay...
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: Want me to have someone else deal with that Infected? It's not exactly a big deal.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: If this keeps up, will this curse never leave me?
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Err... Since when are curses real?
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: Do you not see it?! It's as real as anything! It's chasing after me! The evil spirits are after me!
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Just calm down, ma'am... Everyone's looking at us.
attributes.name: Judge's Subordinate

attributes.content: Anyway, don't worry about that Infected for now. I need to calm myself first.
attributes.name: Town Judge

attributes.content: Well, as promised, I'll tell you what I know.
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: To be blunt, you're wasting your time here. There's no underground Originium mine like you might've guessed, or a big scary factory either.
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: All that happened was some gang war that lasted about a month, and a lot of us were unlucky enough to get caught in the crossfire. That's all there is to it.
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: By the way, I've heard that there's been quite a bit of Originium smuggling going on...
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: If the gangsters used it to make explosives, and didn't follow safety standards during production, it'd be easy for active Originium dust to leak out.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: It's also very common for those who get infected to not notice their physical symptoms at first. Or worse, hide them. This can create the false impression that new patients are still appearing.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Nobody's stupid enough to tell a doctor that they got infected in a gang war.
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: They'll just pretend they didn't see anything.
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: But if there was such large-scale, open conflict going on, why didn't the judges put a stop to it?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Judges? Haha, I don't know how they do things in the big city, but there are no judges out in the boonies.
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: The gangsters were backed by different famiglie, and they fought until one side drove the other completely out of town and took control.
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: The 'judge' you met earlier was just an ordinary mafiosa used by the winning famiglia to control us here.
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Ugh... Sorry, I really only intended to ask about the Oripathy.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Thank you for helping us complete our mission.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Haha, I should be thanking you, if only for pushing my bad luck back one day...
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: That said, your little girl here doesn't seem to want my thanks.
attributes.name: Mauro, Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Don't worry about her. She tends to space out, but I'm sure she heard what you said.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: One more thing, after you head back, remember to take this medicine to control your condition. Take care.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Shamare.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: I told you, Morte would help him. Why didn't you believe me?
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: No, that's not what I meant. Actually, you've already done too much, for too many people.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: The next time you use your Originium Arts, make sure you discuss it with us first.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: If you'd lost control doing what you did, you could've hurt other people very badly... maybe even yourself.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: They always tell me that back at Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: As long as Morte doesn't get hurt, it doesn't matter.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: And you always say that. As long as Morte is in good spirits, as long as Morte doesn't get hurt, it doesn't matter.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: But the truth is, I can tell you're already extremely worn out. I can't let that build up to the point where it affects your health.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: ...I know.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: I won't use any more Arts here.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: Also... Give me another apple. Not the Arts Unit.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: I want something to eat.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: Haha, sure.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: We've confirmed the source of the infection here, and now that we've finished our emergency treatment for the remaining Infected, it's time we headed back to the landship.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Packed up all your tools? If there's nothing else, be ready to pull out.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Oh.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: My apologies. Everyone, pull your carts over and let the disabled woman through.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: ...Is your investigation over? I heard that your company was looking into the cause of all these infections. Did you get your results?
attributes.name: Town 'Judge'

attributes.content: Ah, about that...
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: The time we have on these business trips is extremely limited, and unfortunately we were unable to determine a single cause of the outbreak. Our sincerest apologies.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Morte.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: Go get her book for me.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: (For some, being thrust into an environment that reminds them of the past would only stir up the pain buried deep in their hearts... But maybe, for Shamare, that was never a problem to begin with.)
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: (Though it's hardly normal, she is indeed growing in her own way.)
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Um, Shamare, I have to praise you for having the composure to do what you did.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Huh? What do you mean?
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: The reason you used your Arts is probably because you—Or rather, because Morte felt a pain from this town similar to the pain it knew from before.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: People treat each other with malice, and vent those emotions at one another.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: And even though so many people knew that you weren't the source of the curse, and that you were completely innocent... nobody was willing to those words out loud.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: So in this small town, you used your Arts to help everyone speak out, including the Infected.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: 'There are no words in that codex.'
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: You've grown so much I'm almost astounded.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: You're... weird.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: Morte doesn't need to think about complicated stuff like that, so I don't either.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: Morte just wanted to eat that judge's emotions, so I fed it. Isn't that all there is to it?
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: I see. So you didn't put that much thought into it, huh?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: And I spent so long mulling it over before finally authorizing you to use your Originium Arts...
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: But I guess in the end, I only felt like she was being a bully and had to be punished... I suppose simple reasons like that can be fine too.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: —Hey, hold on, the thought that maybe I don't need to lecture you for this just suddenly popped into my head... Don't tell me that was another one of your 'spiritual suggestions'?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: And why are you smiling?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: I brought your crutches.
attributes.name: 'Judge's' Subordinate

attributes.content: Alright. I'm going to rest for now. I'll let you know if I need anything later.
attributes.name: Town 'Judge'

attributes.content: Gotcha.
attributes.name: 'Judge's' Subordinate

attributes.content: Phew... I haven't heard of any more curses these last few days, so maybe this nightmare is finally ending.
attributes.name: Town 'Judge'

attributes.content: What a pleasant Sunday morning. Now that the rain has passed, the air feels fresher than usual.
attributes.name: Town 'Judge'

attributes.content: Hmm?
attributes.name: Town 'Judge'

attributes.content: The legal codex she had offhandedly placed on the table is blown to a new page by a gust of wind.
Fwoosh, fwoosh.
She sees a line of writing on it. A line with the same handwriting as the curse from before.

attributes.text: 'You will see these words on a Sunday morning, and shall incur a curse.'
'You shall tremble in fear before the consequences of your malice, and decide to change your evil ways.'
